entry.title: Paper Describing Bitcoin Simulation Will Appear at CSET 2015
entry.content:
Our paper entitled “Shadow-Bitcoin: Scalable Simulation via Direct Execution of Multi-threaded Applications” has been accepted to the 8th Workshop on Cybersecurity Experimenation and Test (CSET) 2015! It describes how we were able to run our own private Bitcoin network for experimental purposes using the Shadow simulator. The private Bitcoin network made it easy to debug our Bitcoin code modifications and test the attacks that are also presented in the paper, and we think it will be a useful starting point for future Bitcoin research and development.

CSET is co-located with USENIX Security and will be held in DC on 2015/08/10. Check out the full CSET 2015 program.

entry.title: The Sniper Attack Won the NRL Berman Award
entry.content: Our paper entitled “The Sniper Attack: Anonymously Deanonymizing and Disabling the Tor Network” won the 47th Annual Alan Berman Research Publication Award! This award was given by the U.S. Naval Research Laboratory on 2015-04-17 for best paper in the Information Technology Division.

entry.title: Paper Accepted to WPES 2014
entry.content: Our paper entitled “IMUX: Managing Tor Connections from Two to Infinity, and Beyond” has been accepted to WPES 2014!

entry.title: Blog Post Summarizing New Tor+Bitcoin Research
entry.content: I just published a new post on the TorProject blog summarizing the current state of research on Tor incentive schemes and related challenges. The post includes information about the new TorCoin and TEARS research papers that will appear at HotPETs later this week.

entry.title: Paper Accepted to USENIX Security 2014
entry.content: Our paper entitled “Never Been KIST: Tor’s Congestion Management Blossoms with Kernel-Informed Socket Transport” has been conditionally accepted upon shepherd approval accepted to USENIX Security 2014!
